{"seo": [], "title": "PAUL RUSSO, EBS", "parent": null, "cta_link": "entry::3374", "cta_text": "Back to Executive Management", "leadership": "executive-management", "updated_by": 30, "footer_type": "footers/main_footer", "header_type": "headers/country", "bottom_bar_nav": null, "team_member_text": "

Paul Russo, EBS, is the Chief Executive Officer of KCB Group PLC, appointed in May 2022. He is a member of the Boards of KCB Group PLC, KCB Bank Kenya, National Bank of Kenya (NBK), KCB Investment Bank, KCB Foundation, BPR Bank Rwanda Plc and Trust Merchant Bank (TMB). He is also a member of the Kenya Bankers Association Governing Council, the banking industry lobby.


Paul also sits in the Boards of the National Investment Council, Presidential Taskforce on the establishment of a National Lottery and the National Steering Committee on Drought Response, appointed by Kenya’s President William Ruto. He is also a member of Steering Committee for the World Rally Championship (WRC) Safari Rally Project.


He was feted with a state commendation- Elder of the Order of the Burning Spear (EBS) by the President for his immense contribution in Kenya’s financial services sector. He also serves in the United Nations Environment Programme Finance (UNEP-FI) Leadership Council, joining other global leaders in mainstreaming and deepening sustainability integration across the financial industry.


He is responsible for overseeing the transformation of KCB Group into the undisputed leader in the financial services sector and a customer-focused financial powerhouse. He has extensive experience in banking, strategy, operational and people management. Paul is passionate about transforming the lives of communities, entrenching sustainable business practices and empowering people. “We must drive and deliver meaningful change and contribution in the society. At the end of the day, to claim success, we must challenge the status quo, take deliberate steps that may be outside our comfort zone to create a lasting and sustainable impact to the lives of the communities which we serve.”


Previously, Paul served as the Regional Business Director, KCB Group Plc, and the MD NBK. A HR practioner, he has close to 25 years of work experience spanning executive and key roles including Group HR Director, KCB. He has served in other big corporates such as Barclays, PwC, K-Rep Bank, EABL, and Unga Holdings. He holds an MBA from Strathmore University Business School and a Bachelor of Business Management from Moi University. He also has a senior executive program for Africa Certificate from Harvard Business School.

Lawrence Kimathi holds a Masters in Business Administration (MBA) with a merit from Warwick Business School UK, a Bachelor of Science degree majoring in accounting from United States International University – Africa (USIU) and is a Certified Public Accountant of Kenya, CPA (K).


He is a member of the Institute of Certified Public Accountants of Kenya and Institute of Directors. His senior leadership experience spans over 25 years having worked as Finance Director/CFO in a number of multinational organizations which include Cadbury East and Central Africa, AIG, East Africa Breweries Limited, BAT Sub Sahara Africa and BAT PLC in London.


OTHER DIRECTORSHIPS: Lawrence serves in the KCB Uganda board and is a trustee of the KCB Staff Pension Fund defined benefit scheme.

{"seo": [], "title": "Annastacia Kimtai", "parent": null, "cta_link": "entry::3374", "cta_text": "Back to Executive Management", "leadership": null, "updated_by": 30, "footer_type": "footers/main_footer", "header_type": "headers/country", "bottom_bar_nav": null, "team_member_text": "

Annastacia Kimtai, KCB Bank Kenya’s Managing Director is an astute career Banker with over twenty five (25) years experience in Banking, twelve (12) years of which have been in senior management roles in Strategic Leadership and Business  Development. She previously served as Director, Retail Banking where she was in charge of over 210 branches in Kenya. 


Annastacia sits on the Boards of KCB Bank Kenya, KCB Foundation, KCB Bank Kenya’s Board Credit Committee, KCB Bank Kenya’s Board Strategy & Digital Committee, and KCB Bank Kenya’s Board Audit Committee. She is also a Non-Executive Board Member of the Kenya Mortgage Refinance Company (KMRC).


Annastacia has championed financial inclusion for customers at the bottom of the pyramid by steering development of products and services to serve this niche clientele. Annastacia is an expert in managing and turning around troubled business as part of the team seconded to manage Chase Bank and Imperial Bank in Receivership. She is also spearheading the Bank’s Flme (Female Led and Made Enterprises) project  for inclusion of more business women in Banking.


Other than being knowledgeable, dynamic and results oriented, Annastacia is a strategic thinker whose strength lies in execution of goals leading to consistent delivery of exceptional results.  Annastacia’s strength is in people leadership with a bias for effective communication which enables  her to nurture, mentor and coach leaders. A person of high integrity with strong values of honesty, fairness, commitment to corporate governance, risk management and compliance, she works seamlessly with cross-functional and cross-cultural teams, and participates in networking and stakeholder engagements. She believes in strong leaders being accountable for results, being effective, being reliable, being competent, and being authentic.


Annastacia holds a MBA Degree in Business Administration & Strategic Management, MA Degree in Rural Economics and Cooperation, a


BA Degree in Community Development, Economics and Rural Banking. She is a Certified Executive Coach from the Academy of Executive Coaching (AOEC). She is a graduate of the Senior Executive Program for Africa (SEPA) from Harvard University and the Global Executive Development Program from Gordon Institute of Business Science (GIBS) Business School.

{"seo": [], "title": "Cosmas Kimario", "parent": null, "cta_link": "entry::3374", "cta_text": "Back to Executive Management", "leadership": "executive-management", "updated_by": 30, "footer_type": "footers/main_footer", "header_type": "headers/country", "bottom_bar_nav": null, "team_member_text": "

Cosmas Kimario is the Group Regional Businesses Director, KCB Group PLC with effect from January 25, 2023.


Cosmas is a seasoned banker with over 25 years of experience in Finance and Treasury. He is known for his proven track record of success in managing financial and commodity derivatives, corporate treasury teams and other financial divisions. 


With a wealth of experience in Treasury and Derivative Sales, gained while working across Citigroup USA, London in the UK, Lagos in Nigeria, Dakar in Senegal, Nairobi in Kenya and Dar es Salaam in Tanzania, Cosmas has a deep understanding of the global financial markets. His ability to develop complex financial instruments is a testament to his expertise. Cosmas is one of the pioneers who introduced Foreign Exchange Options and Derivatives in many markets in Africa including Tanzania, Nigeria, Uganda and Zambia.


Managing teams of professionals in multiple locations has given him a well-rounded perspective of finance, treasury operations and general business management skills. His ability to lead, manage and motivate teams of professionals in challenging environments has resulted in significant growth of the businesses he has led.


Cosmas holds an MBA in Finance and a Master of International Management (MIM) from Thunderbird – The American Graduate School of International Management USA as well as Bachelor of Commerce and Management Degree from the University of Dar es Salaam.

Japheth was appointed the Group Human Resource Director, KCB Group PLC on July 8, 2019. He has over 19 years’ of work experience spanning executive and key roles including Africa Regional HR Director (Allianz Africa), Group HR Business Manager – Operations and Technology and Head of HR eProcess International (Ecobank Transnational Incorporated, Accra-Ghana), Head of HR Operations & Employee Shared Services (Safaricom Ltd), West & Central Africa Human Resource Head (Citibank N.A Ltd, Dakar, Senegal), Senior Division Human Resource Generalist- Sub Sahara Africa Division (Citibank N.A Ltd, Johannesburg, South Africa), Acting Country Human Resource Officer (CHRO) - Citibank Tanzania (Citibank N.A Ltd, Dar-es-Salaam, Tanzania) and Compensation and Benefits Manager – Kenya, Tanzania and Uganda (Citibank N.A Ltd, Nairobi, Kenya).

\n \n

Japheth holds a Master’s degree of Science (Human Resource Management & Training) from University of Leicester – London, UK; Post Graduate Certificate (Human Resource Management) from university of Wales – London, UK and Bachelor of Education (B.Ed. Science) from Kenyatta university – Nairobi, Kenya.

Dennis Volemi is the Group Director, Technology , appointed on October 1, 2023.


He has over 18 years experience as a Technology and Business Leader in telecommunications, media and entertainment, and financial services industry with both local and multi-national companies in Kenya. He has a vast knowledge and experience in development of IT strategies, technology management, deployment, score carding and governance in alignment to a company’s vision and mission.


He joined KCB Group from Diamond Trust Bank Limited where he was serving as Chief Information and Digital Officer from April 2023. Prior to this, he was the Group Chief Information Officer at Equity Group Holdings Limited. He has previously worked in senior roles at NCBA Group Limited, Wananchi Group Limited and Safaricom Limited.


Dennis holds a Bachelor of Science from Kenyatta University and a Senior Management Leadership Programme from Strathmore University.

{"seo": [], "title": "BONNIE OKUMU", "parent": null, "cta_link": "entry::3374", "cta_text": "Back to Executive Management", "leadership": "executive-management", "updated_by": 30, "footer_type": "footers/main_footer", "header_type": "headers/country", "bottom_bar_nav": null, "team_member_text": "

Bonnie is the Group General Counsel, KCB Bank Kenya. She was appointed to the role in July 2018. Before the appointment, she was serving as the Head, Legal Services since January 2014. She has served as Company Secretary for KCB Bank Kenya since January 2016.


Before joining KCB, she was the Chief Legal and Regulatory Affairs Officer and Company Secretary at Telkom Kenya Limited. Prior to this she was the General Counsel and Company Secretary at Unilever Kenya Limited where she oversaw the legal and company secretarial functions for 9 operating companies in 7 countries in East and Southern Africa. Until she joined Unilever, she was the Regional Legal Manager for Nestle where she set up the legal department and led a team of lawyers in providing legal and tax advisory services to 14 operating entities in 20 countries in the Equatorial African Region.


Earlier in her career, she was an associate at Hamilton & Mathews where she represented clients including banks, insurance companies and consumer goods companies. She holds an LL.B from the University of Nairobi, is an advocate of the High Court of Kenya as well as a Certified Public Secretary (CPS-K).

Rosalind was appointed the Group Director Marketing & Communication, KCB Group PLC on August 9th, 2021. She has a career spanning over 21 years, having served in various local and international corporations.


Rosalind joined KCB from NCBA Group PLC where she has been serving in a similar capacity since 2019. She has previously worked for NIC Group PLC, Coca-Cola SABCO (now Coca-Cola Beverages Africa), The Coca-Cola Company, and The Gillette Company (now Proctor and Gamble).


She holds a Master of Business Administration (MBA) from Northeastern University, Boston, USA and a Bachelor of Commerce (General Management) from McMaster University Hamilton, Ontario, Canada. She is also a Certified Executive Coach by the Academy of Executive Coaching, United Kingdom.

{"seo": [], "title": "Charles Langa’t", "parent": null, "cta_link": "entry::3374", "cta_text": "Back to Executive Management", "leadership": "executive-management", "updated_by": 30, "footer_type": "footers/main_footer", "header_type": "headers/country", "bottom_bar_nav": null, "team_member_text": "

Education and Professional Background:

Charles Kipngetich Langat is a seasoned professional with a career spanning over 28 years in finance, audit, and corporate governance. Charles holds an MBA in Finance from Heriot Watt University, United Kingdom and a Bachelor of Commerce degree with a specialization in Accounting from the University of Nairobi. He is also a Certified Public Accountant of Kenya (CPA-K), a Certified Internal Auditor (CIA), and a Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA).


Charles's journey to his current role as Director of Audit started as an audit manager in PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC). He then served as the Financial Controller at BOC Kenya Limited, Head of Internal Audit at Bamburi Cement Limited and Divisional Director at Sovereign Group Plc before joining KCB Group on 1st July 2013. These diverse experiences have honed his strategic acumen and audit stewardship skills enabling him to navigate complex challenges in the banking industry.


In his current capacity as Group Director of Audit, Charles plays a pivotal role in ensuring the integrity and efficacy of the Group's internal controls. His key responsibilities include supporting the work of the Group Audit and Risk Committee, leading the internal audit team in executing the risk-based audit plan, and providing independent evaluations of the control environment in conformance with the audit professional standards.


Charles leadership is characterized by his passion in fostering collaboration and communication across functional areas. He maintains dialogue with senior management, offering insights from audit activities through provision of results of the Audit work, and quarterly reporting thus enabling management to evaluate and make control conscious decisions.


An advocate for excellence, Charles conducts regular quality assurance reviews to uphold Global Internal Audit Standards in the work carried out by the Group Internal Audit Division. Furthermore, he collaborates with external auditors and control groups to streamline audit processes and enhance organizational efficiency.


His commitment to excellence continues to drive organizational success, ensuring robust governance frameworks and financial integrity across the Group's operations.

{"seo": [], "title": "Faith Basiye", "cta_link": "entry::3374", "cta_text": "Back to Executive Management", "leadership": "executive-management", "member_car": null, "updated_by": 30, "footer_type": "footers/main_footer", "header_type": "headers/country", "member_club": null, "member_team": null, "bottom_bar_nav": null, "team_member_text": "

Faith Basiye is the Group Chief Risk Officer, appointed on 8th July 2024.

She was previously the Head of Forensic Services, KCB Group. She is a distinguished professional with over 26 years of expertise in risk management, legal advisory, compliance, and forensic investigation, and is instrumental in developing comprehensive risk management strategies across the Group, particularly in financial contexts.


Faith holds a Bachelor of Laws Degree and a Post Graduate Diploma in Legal Studies. She also holds the following certificates: Certified Public Secretary (CPS) Kenya, Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE), and Computer Forensics Expert.


Faith's career spans pivotal roles in both public and private sectors, including Senior Fraud Manager at Safaricom Ltd and Forensic Manager at KPMG, where she specialized in financial crime management. Her tenure at the Kenya Anti-Corruption Commission focused on forensic investigation of corruption and economic crimes, highlighting her commitment to integrity and transparency.


Faith has been recognized for her contributions, including being named among the Top 40 under 40 Women in Kenya, two years running- 2012 and 2013, and recently she was named among the Top 50 Lawyers in Kenya and Top 10 Women Lawyers in Private Sector (In-house) practitioners during the Nairobi Legal Awards, 2024.Beyond her professional achievements, Faith is known for her dedication to mentoring and sports, embodying a balance of professional excellence and personal fulfillment.

{"seo": [], "title": "National Treasury (Geoffrey Malombe)", "parent": null, "cta_link": "entry::3397", "cta_text": "Back to Board of Directors", "leadership": "board-of-director", "updated_by": 30, "footer_type": "footers/main_footer", "header_type": "headers/country", "bottom_bar_nav": null, "team_member_text": "

The Government of Kenya has maintained varied levels of ownership in the company since acquisition in 1970. This has been managed through the Office of the Cabinet Secretary Treasury (formerly, Permanent Secretary Treasury). Below is a chronology of the evolution in the ownership:


1. The Government of Kenya acquired 100% shareholding in National and Grindlays Bank in 1970 and re-named it Kenya Commercial Bank (now KCB Group Plc)


2. In 1998, the Government sold 20% of its shares at the NSE through an IPO that saw 120,000 new shareholders acquire the company


3. The Government sold 10%, 10% and 25% in 1990,1996 and 1998 respectively, reducing its shareholding to 35%


4. A series of rights issues in 2004, 2008 and 2010 were conducted by the company, with proceeds channeled towards growing the business and financing regional expansion. The Government opted not to take up its rights effectively diluting its ownership to 26.2%, 23.6% and 17.3% respectively


5. The Board in 2016 introduced a scrip dividend where shareholders received dividends partly in cash and partly as additional shares. The Government took up this offer, marginally increasing its shareholding to the current level of 17.5%.


6. In 2019, KCB Group Plc concluded the acquisition of National Bank of Kenya via swap shares. From the transaction, the C.S. National Treasury, being a shareholder of National Bank, received additional KCB Group Plc shares increasing the total shareholding from 17.5% to 19.76%.

Simeon Rono has over 20 years’ experience in banking having previously worked in various capacities at the Central Bank of Kenya. He holds a Bachelor of Commerce Degree (Hons.), Marketing Option, from the University of Nairobi. He. He has attended several courses, both locally and internationally in banking, corporate management and regulatory oversight.


Simeon has a wealth of knowledge and experience in financial management, Anti Money laundering (AML) controls, internal controls, risk management and regulatory oversight. He is also well versed with the formulation of management policies and is a keen promoter of social and economic development.


Simeon is a founder and director of several companies engaged in the hospitality industry.

{"seo": [], "title": "NJERI ONYANGO", "parent": null, "cta_link": "entry::3397", "cta_text": "Back to Board of Directors", "leadership": "board-of-director", "updated_by": 30, "footer_type": "footers/main_footer", "header_type": "headers/country", "bottom_bar_nav": null, "team_member_text": "

Mrs Njeri Onyango a graduate of the University of Nairobi, is an Advocate of the High Court of Kenya with 30 years’ experience in legal practise. She has engaged in broad practise of law such as civil and criminal litigation, arbitration, commercial law, property transactions, labour relations and sports law. She is a Certified Professional Mediator having received her certification from the Mediation Training Institute International (MTI).


Mrs Onyango has also done remarkable consultancy services with a wide range of institutions. She has chaired legal, constitutional and disciplinary committees in various sports federations and has participated in constitution writing and reviews for federations such as Tennis Kenya and Kenya Volleyball Federation. She has served in various international disciplinary and legal tribunals such as The World Volleyball Federation (FIVB) and the World Swimming Federation (FINA).


She was appointed as a legal consultant for The Ministry of Youth Sports, Culture and The Arts to offer consultancy services to the Ministry on the Kenya Anti Doping Bill and Policy, which become the Kenya Anti Doping Act, 2016. She has also acted as a legal consultant for the Kenya Anti-Doping Agency (KADA); she chaired the Legal Committee of KADA in the preparation of the Rules for Anti-Doping in Sports in Kenya that were consequently approved and adopted by the world Anti-Doping Agency. She has provided legal consultancy services to a number of NGOs. Mrs Onyango is currently a Board member of the Independent Policing Oversight Authority (IPOA) and a member of the Kenya Sports Disputes Tribunal.


Mrs Onyango is a member a number of professional bodies such as the Law Society of Kenya, the Chartered Institute of Arbitrators both, International Bar Association, International Federation of Women Lawyers (FIDA).

Caroline Okong’o has over 20 years’ experience in finance, risk, audit, strategy development and implementation support. She is a results-oriented leader with a history of achieving excellence and impact through teams.


Having worked both locally and internationally, Caroline has had multi-jurisdiction exposure dealing with various regulatory reporting requirements in the financial services sector. She has held leadership roles in various organizations which include Assistant Vice President at Willis Management (Bermuda), Director at Lattice Consulting Limited and Senior Manager at Deloitte where she worked in both East Africa and Bermuda.


Caroline holds a Bachelor of Arts in Building Economics from the University of Nairobi, is a CPA (K) member of ICPAK, and a Certified Professional Coach (CPC) accredited by the International Coaching Federation. She runs an advisory consulting and coaching practice.


Caroline is an Independent Non-Executive Board Member at Prudential Life Assurance Kenya Limited, and a Non-Executive Board Member of WWF Kenya.

{"seo": [], "title": "Annastacia Kimtai", "parent": null, "cta_link": "entry::3397", "cta_text": "Back to Board of Directors", "leadership": "board-of-director", "updated_by": 30, "footer_type": "footers/main_footer", "header_type": "headers/country", "bottom_bar_nav": null, "team_member_text": "

Annastacia Kimtai, KCB Bank Kenya’s Managing Director is an astute career Banker with over twenty five (25) years experience in Banking, twelve (12) years of which have been in senior management roles in Strategic Leadership and Business  Development. She previously served as Director, Retail Banking where she was in charge of over 210 branches in Kenya. 


Annastacia sits on the Boards of KCB Bank Kenya, KCB Foundation, KCB Bank Kenya’s Board Credit Committee, KCB Bank Kenya’s Board Strategy & Digital Committee, and KCB Bank Kenya’s Board Audit Committee. She is also a Non-Executive Board Member of the Kenya Mortgage Refinance Company (KMRC).


Annastacia has championed financial inclusion for customers at the bottom of the pyramid by steering development of products and services to serve this niche clientele. Annastacia is an expert in managing and turning around troubled business as part of the team seconded to manage Chase Bank and Imperial Bank in Receivership. She is also spearheading the Bank’s Flme (Female Led and Made Enterprises) project  for inclusion of more business women in Banking.


Other than being knowledgeable, dynamic and results oriented, Annastacia is a strategic thinker whose strength lies in execution of goals leading to consistent delivery of exceptional results.  Annastacia’s strength is in people leadership with a bias for effective communication which enables  her to nurture, mentor and coach leaders. A person of high integrity with strong values of honesty, fairness, commitment to corporate governance, risk management and compliance, she works seamlessly with cross-functional and cross-cultural teams, and participates in networking and stakeholder engagements. She believes in strong leaders being accountable for results, being effective, being reliable, being competent, and being authentic.


Annastacia holds a MBA Degree in Business Administration & Strategic Management, MA Degree in Rural Economics and Cooperation, a


BA Degree in Community Development, Economics and Rural Banking. She is a Certified Executive Coach from the Academy of Executive Coaching (AOEC). She is a graduate of the Senior Executive Program for Africa (SEPA) from Harvard University and the Global Executive Development Program from Gordon Institute of Business Science (GIBS) Business School.

He is a member of the Kenya Treasurers’ Association, a body that lobby for financial market development issues and a member of ACI Kenya- the financial market Dealers’ Association.


Peter sits in the CBK Bond Market Forum, a committee that deliberates on bond issuance, macro-economic and debt market matters.


He leads the treasury team in running the treasury business that includes Assets and liabilities management, provision of treasury FX solutions to clients that includes hedging, Treasury proprietary trading activities for both Fixed income and FX books and supports to internal on Treasury matters. {"seo": [], "title": "Davis Musungu Chenge", "cta_link": "entry::3417", "cta_text": "Back to Members", "leadership": null, "member_car": null, "updated_by": 30, "footer_type": "footers/main_footer", "header_type": "headers/country", "member_club": null, "member_team": null, "bottom_bar_nav": null, "team_member_text": "

What inspired you to play rugby?

Went to high school in Bungoma High school which has a very rich rugby culture. I started watching first out of curiosity which grew to interest then I found myself playing.


Where are you from? Which hood do you represent?

Born and raised in Bungoma, Kimilili. Mi ni msee wa Kims.


How has KCB Bank supported or influenced your rugby career?

KCB has helped provide the best environment to practise and grow my game. I'm provided with a quality coaching team, medical cover and renumeration which makes it easy for me to just focus on the game.


What is your proudest moment/achievement in your rugby journey?

Representing Kenya in both the 7s and 15s versions of the game and serving as captain at various points for the 2 disciplines.


What does a typical training day look like for you?

Varies....sometimes it starts at 6am through to 7.15am when I break to go to the office then get back 5.30pm for the evening session which ends at around 7.00pm, on Sartudays we start at 6.00am to 12.00am.


What is your pre-match routine before a game?

I try to sleep in, wake up at around 10.00am. I don't like having lunch on game day so I would just have heavy breakfast at around 10.00am then at around 1.00pm I'll have 2 bananas. Then listen to some music as I get myself ready for the game. As the game draws near I like to be in my own quiet relaxed space, then switch things up come warm up time.


Current favorite song?

Sweetie Wa Mayi--Matata 24.


Who is your sports role model? Can be any sport, not specifically rugby

Humphrey Khayange.


What is the next big goal you're working towards?

Winning my 5th Kenya cup trophy with KCB.


When you're not playing rugby, what do you enjoy doing?

Reading, music or movies.


What is your life motto/mantra/guiding principle?

Control the controllables don't stress on things you can't control.


Where would you like to compete one day? We might just make it happen

I have been lucky to compete in most of the places I'd have wanted to compete in to which I'm grateful. My goal now is to help the younger players achieve their best potential and compete at the highest levels possible.


What would you tell a young athlete looking up to you?

You can achieve anything you want to as long as you respect the process keep your eye on your goal and keep working tirelessly towards it. Sometime it comes quick, sometimes it takes time, don't relent.

{"seo": [], "title": "Dennis Kiogothi Waithaka", "cta_link": "entry::3417", "cta_text": "Back to Members", "leadership": null, "member_car": null, "updated_by": 30, "footer_type": "footers/main_footer", "header_type": "headers/country", "member_club": null, "member_team": null, "bottom_bar_nav": null, "team_member_text": "

What inspired you to play rugby?

Started in High School, rugby players looked huge and were popular, I wanted to have such status too.


Where are you from? Which hood do you represent?

Mowlem Eastlands.


How has KCB Bank supported or influenced your rugby career?

My association with KCB rugby has been life changing both on and off pitch. Aside from being active on the pitch, I have been able to secure employment as a Network engineer at KCB group.


What is your proudest moment/achievement in your rugby journey?

Winning floodies 2023 and ESS back to back title 2023 and 2024.


What does a typical training day look like for you?

I Wake up at 4:30 am and prepare for the day, commute to the Den and arrive before 6 am. Put in the morning session from 6am to 7 am. Freshen up and leave for work. In the evening, I leave work at 4:30 pm arrive at the Den at 5 pm and prepare for the evening session. Between 5:30pm and 7:30 pm evening session is done, freshen up after practice and head home. I mostly arrive home at 9pm. I Hit the sheets by 10pm.


What is your pre-match routine before a game?

Take a cold shower then I listen to reggae or rap music.


Current favorite song?

Never dis di man by Sanchez.


Who is your sports role model? Can be any sport, not specifically rugby

LeBron James.


What is the next big goal you're working towards?

Win a Kenya Cup title, I'm yet to put my hands on it.


When you're not playing rugby, what do you enjoy doing?

Dog walks, learning a skill, Gaming🎮


What is your life motto/mantra/guiding principle?

If it can be done today, do it today, tomorrow will take care of itself.


Where would you like to compete one day? We might just make it happen

Play international rugby for my country.


What would you tell a young athlete looking up to you?

As you focus on your rugby career put more emphasis on your academic papers. An athlete career is dog years, you will need those papers after your playing days.

What Sport Are You Passionate About?

Volleyball

Bungoma County, Mt Elgon Constituency.


How has KCB Bank supported or influenced your playing career?

I really appreciate KCB Bank for the financial support that has really played a bigger role in my sports career.

Travelling abroad for bigger competitions in countries like Tunisia being one of the achievements and the proudest moments in my sporting journey .

It's always between four to five hours and sometimes even more, and we do enjoy engaging in different drills during the training.


What is your pre-match routine before a game?

Warm ups are the most important preparation process, we do dance the Luhya songs to bring out confidence .


Current favorite song?

local music more so the Luhya songs got the vibes.


Who is your sports role model? Can be any sport.

Mercy Moim.


What is the next big goal you're working towards?

Playing for the Kenya National team and thereafter playing as a professional player in professional clubs abroad.

Engaging in fun activities and listening to music.


What is your life motto/mantra/guiding principle?

I believe in my strengths.


Where would you like to compete one day? We might just make it happen

Brazil.


What would you tell a young athlete looking up to you?

Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection, we can catch excellence, train hard, and believe in yourselves.
